sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Workforce Development through Charitable Loan Repayment Act
sections.text: References in this Article to "this Act" mean this Article.

sections.heading: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to create a private sector incentive for qualified workers to work and live in eligible areas while also reducing the student debt burden of those workers
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to create a private sector incentive for qualified workers to work and live in eligible areas while also reducing the student debt burden of those workers.

sections.heading: Applications. sections.text: Eligibility; work requirement. Each individual qualified community foundation shall certify the eligibility of qualified workers to receive student loan repayment assistance and establish work requirements in accordance with this Act, rules adopted by the Commission, and the requirements of the individual qualified community foundation.

sections.heading: Administration; rules. Qualified community foundations shall administer the Program under this Act and shall issue to qualified workers any forms required by the Commission or the Department of Revenue

sections.heading: Reporting. Each qualified community foundation shall submit an annual report to the Commission summarizing its loan repayment activity under the Program
sections.text: Reports under this Section shall be submitted in the form and manner prescribed by the Commission.

sections.text: No acceleration or delay. Where this Act makes changes in a statute that is represented in this Act by text that is not yet or no longer in effect (for example, a Section represented by multiple versions), the use of that text does not accelerate or delay the taking effect of (i) the changes made by this Act or (ii) provisions derived from any other Public Act.

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
sections.text: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law, except that Article 65 takes effect July 1, 2024, Articles 25, 75, 80, 93, 125, 135, and 140 take effect January 1, 2025, and Article 150 takes effect July 1, 2025
